docs.snippet: The FBI is investigating a cyber attack against another U.S. Democratic Party group, which may be related to an earlier hack against the Democratic National Committee, four people familiar with the matter told Reuters....
docs.lead_paragraph: The FBI is investigating a cyber attack against another U.S. Democratic Party group, which may be related to an earlier hack against the Democratic National Committee, four people familiar with the matter told Reuters.

headline.main: Exclusive: FBI Probes Hacking of Democratic Congressional Group-Sources
headline.print_headline: Exclusive: FBI Probes Hacking of Democratic Congressional Group-Sources

docs.snippet: Director of National Intelligence James Clapper, speaking about the hack of Democratic Party emails, said on Thursday the U.S. intelligence community was not ready to "make the call on attribution" as to who was responsible....
docs.lead_paragraph: Director of National Intelligence James Clapper, speaking about the hack of Democratic Party emails, said on Thursday the U.S. intelligence community was not ready to "make the call on attribution" as to who was responsible.

headline.main: U.S. Intelligence Chief Not Ready to Identify Source of Democratic Email Hack
headline.print_headline: U.S. Intelligence Chief Not Ready to Identify Source of Democratic Email Hack

docs.snippet: The prosecutor secured not a single conviction against six officers charged. But she offered a passionate defense of her decision to pursue the case....
docs.lead_paragraph: The prosecutor secured not a single conviction against six officers charged. But she offered a passionate defense of her decision to pursue the case.
docs.abstract: Baltimore state's attorney Marilyn J Mosby drops all remaining charges against three police officers still awaiting trial for their role in death of Freddie Gray, ending one of most closely watched police prosecutions in nation with no convictions and few answers about how Gray died; defends her decision, attributing it to impossibility of securing convictions against officers without reform of city's criminal justice system.

headline.main: All Charges Dropped Against Baltimore Officers in Freddie Gray Case
headline.print_headline: Baltimore Case Closed, With No Guilty Verdicts

byline.contributor: Sheryl Gay Stolberg reported from Baltimore, and Jess Bidgood from Boston. Reporting was contributed by Gary Gately from Baltimore; Ashley Parker from Doral, Fla.; and Richard Pérez-Peña from New York.
byline.original: By SHERYL GAY STOLBERG and JESS BIDGOOD
